meanings.definition: To selfishly monopolize or keep something for oneself.
meanings.sent1: Tommy was bogarting all the toys at playtime.
meanings.sent2: She was bogarting the snacks, not leaving any for others.
meanings.sent3: Stop bogarting the TV remote, let someone else choose a show.
meanings.sent4: He was bogarting the conversation, not letting anyone else speak.
meanings.sent5: The bully was bogarting the swing, not letting anyone else have a turn.

meanings.definition: To hog or take more than one's fair share.
meanings.sent1: The greedy squirrel was bogarting all the nuts in the park.
meanings.sent2: She was bogarting the crayons, leaving none for the other kids.
meanings.sent3: The cat was bogarting the sunny spot on the window sill.
meanings.sent4: The team captain was bogarting the ball, not passing it to others.
meanings.sent5: The older brother was bogarting the cookies, not sharing with his siblings.

meanings.definition: To act in a possessive or controlling manner.
meanings.sent1: The supervisor was bogarting all the decision-making power.
meanings.sent2: He was bogarting the project, not allowing others to contribute.
meanings.sent3: She was bogarting the group project, insisting on her ideas only.
meanings.sent4: The dictator was bogarting the country, suppressing any opposition.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was bogarting the classroom, not letting students speak freely.
